main_definition: Eagles is an idiom that generally refers to exceptional individuals or entities with superior skills, abilities or dominance.

meanings_and_examples.example: Their team was the eagles of the league, always emerging victorious due to their remarkable physical prowess.
She's a real eagle in programming; her skills far exceed those of most developers I know.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Dominance in a particular field or sector
meanings_and_examples.example: The tech company is the eagles of innovation, constantly introducing groundbreaking products and technologies.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Symbolism for something that stands out due to its uniqueness or rare qualities
meanings_and_examples.example: His artwork was truly one-of-a-kind; he could be considered an eagle in the world of fine arts.
